page.title: 03Educating the Working Man
page.content: Harold Jones is one of Crosskeys' most famous sons. Born in 1900, Harold worked in the Risca pit from 13 until his retirement in 1965. He was a local Labour Councillor and Compensation Secretary for the N.U.M. He has been a tireless worker in the community and even at 85 is active, running a Senior Citizens' Club which he set up. One of Harold's most memorable achievements was the establishment in 1928 of an unemployed men's educational group. During 1928-1929 Oxford City "adopted" Risca and, using the unemployed group, established an educational settlement. Key figures involved were Lady Tweedsmuir (wife of John Buchan),and the philosopher C. M. Joad, the then Master of Balliol College. The settlement became "Oxford House", which still runs as an Adult Education Centre.
